sentence.Network_en: This was a matter less of morals than of expediency.
sentence.Network_cn: 此举只是权宜之计，不关乎道德问题。

sentence.Network_en: The government is torn between principle and expediency.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府在原则与权宜之间难于抉择.

sentence.Network_en: It was difficult to strike the right balance between justice and expediency.
sentence.Network_cn: 在公正与私利之间很难两全.

entry.tran: 不得已而做的事;权宜之计
entry.def: Expediency means doing what is convenient rather than what is morally right.

example.ex: It seems political expediency, rather than absolute economic need, will determine who gains from the conflict...
example.tran: 看来是政治上的权宜之计，而不是绝对的经济需求，将决定谁会从这场冲突中获益。

example.ex: This was a matter less of morals than of expediency.
example.tran: 此举只是权宜之计，不关乎道德问题。

means.word_mean: 1. the quality of being suited to the end in view

auth_sentence.content: The Saville Inquiry was born out of political expediency.

auth_sentence.content: But it endures because of its political expediency.
